Sweet & Sticky Salmon Skewers

Ingredients

  • 400 g salmon
  • 2 tsp garlic infused oil
  • 1.5 tsp crushed ginger
  • 1.5 tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 lime
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp sesame seeds

Method

  1. Debone and skin the salmon, then cut into 2.5cm (1 inch) cubes.
  2. In a bowl, mix together the garlic infused oil, crushed ginger, maple syrup, lime juice and zest, and soy sauce.
  3. Add the salmon and allow to marinate for 10 minutes.
  4. Place the wooden skewers in a bowl of water (this will help stop them burning).
  5. Slide the salmon pieces onto skewers (we do 1 per person). Place in a lightly oiled roasting tray. Then grill in the oven for 8 to 10 minutes until cooked through. Turn 3 times during cooking (every couple of minutes), each time basting with more marinade.
  6. While the salmon cooks, toast the sesame seeds over medium high heat for 1 to 2 minutes until golden.
  7. Serve the sweet and sticky salmon skewers with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds.
